page.title: 05The Turkey Farm
page.content:
To the east of St.Germans village, there is a specialised farm for rearing turkeys. This comprises a series of large sheds with domed roof / corrugated sheet construction.
Norfolk provides many of the turkeys required for British tables, and the meat is increasingly popular year-round (perhaps because it is less expensive than beef!!).
The turkeys live in large groups, completely indoors, on a deep sawdust floor, with controlled light, ventilation and heating.
The farm rears them from eggs, and one section kills and prepares them for the processing factory which transforms the meat into joints, burgers etc.
